list_definition.definition: to bear the weight of, or hold upright, in place etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: That chair won’t support him / his weight
He limped home, supported by a friend on either side of him.

list_definition.definition: to give help, or approval to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has always supported our cause
His family supported him in his decision.

list_definition.definition: to provide evidence for the truth of

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: New discoveries have been made that support his theory
The second witness supported the statement of the first one.

list_definition.definition: to supply with the means of living

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has a wife and four children to support.

list_definition.mean_english: sự chống đỡ, sự được chống đỡ
list_definition.definition: the act of supporting or state of being supported

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: That type of shoe doesn’t give the foot much support
The plan was cancelled because of lack of support
Her job is the family’s only means of support
I would like to say a word or two in support of his proposal.
One of the supports of the bridge collapsed.
